title: How to Determine if the Motor Coupler is Broken in your Washing Machine

steps.title: Set the timer dial in the regular wash cycle.
steps.content: Set the timer dial in the regular wash cycle. If the washer fills to the selected level and starts agitating properly, then the problem is not a broken motor coupler. [1] X Research source

steps.title: If the washer fills to the selected level and you hear the motor running but the washer is not agitating, set the dial on the spin cycle.
steps.content: If the washer fills to the selected level and you hear the motor running but the washer is not agitating, set the dial on the spin cycle. If the washer drains the water and you hear the motor running (making noise but not spinning), it is likely you have a broken motor coupler. [2] X Research source

steps.title: If you replace the motor coupler yourself it probably will cost you about $20.
steps.content: If you replace the motor coupler yourself it probably will cost you about $20. [3] X Research source

steps.title: If you have to have a repairman come to your house and do the repair for you, it could cost you about US$120.
steps.content: If you have to have a repairman come to your house and do the repair for you, it could cost you about US$120. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove bolt from agitator from inside washing machine tub.
steps.content: Remove bolt from agitator from inside washing machine tub.

steps.title: Remove the 3 silver bolts from under the washing machine tub underneath the washer.
steps.content: Remove the 3 silver bolts from under the washing machine tub underneath the washer. Make sure you unplug the wiring assembly from the drive. [5] X Research source

steps.title: After you remove the 3 bolts , the motor will fall out.
steps.content: After you remove the 3 bolts , the motor will fall out.

steps.title: Remove the 2 metal screw from the clips holding assembly together.
steps.content: Remove the 2 metal screw from the clips holding assembly together. [6] X Research source

steps.title: When you remove screws the coupler will be the 2 plastic pieces with 3 prongs and a rubber coupling.
steps.content: When you remove screws the coupler will be the 2 plastic pieces with 3 prongs and a rubber coupling. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Replace and reverse instructions to put all back together.
steps.content: Replace and reverse instructions to put all back together.
